intro: Chamaesyce nummularia, commonly known as silver dollar plant, is a species of flowering plant in the family Portulacaceae. It is native to southern Europe and western Asia, where it thrives in rocky and sandy soils. The plant is characterized by its rounded, silver-gray leaves that are arranged in a rosette pattern. It produces small, inconspicuous yellow flowers that bloom in the spring. Due to its hardy nature and ornamental appearance, it is often cultivated as a decorative plant in gardens and rockeries.
